body.p: With this issue, I end my 6-year tenure as editor of the Community College Review (CCR) and turn over the editorship to Jaime Lester of George Mason University, one of the most accomplished scholars in the community college field. Jaime brings to the job an extensive knowledge of emerging research on community colleges and a keen understanding of the challenges community colleges face as they continue to promote the academic success of students entering through the open door. She is also a fine writer with a good eye and ear for the language. I am grateful that Jaime has accepted the editorship, and I look forward to her leadership of CCR.

In addition, I am grateful to the many people who have helped me over the past 6 years. Carol Kasworm and Duane Akroyd of North Carolina State University extended considerable support, as did Jenny Hamlin, Satvinder Kaur, Allison Leung, and Manisha Singh of Sage Publications. I also owe thanks to assistant editors Barbara Metelsky and Tara Thompson, who proofread many manuscripts in between doctoral courses and dissertation work at North Carolina State University. Finally, I am grateful for the thoughtful work of scholars across the country who have reviewed manuscripts for CCR. In 2012, and in the first 6 months of 2013, these reviewers have included the following individuals:
Duane Akroyd, North Carolina State University, Raleigh, NC
Marilyn Amey, Michigan State University, East Lansing, MI
